actor_awards.notes: Johnson received a Primetime Emmy nomination for his role in the miniseries 'Rich Man, Poor Man' (1976). He has a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame at 6600 Hollywood Blvd.

filmography.title: The Caine Mutiny
filmography.role_description: The executive officer of the USS Caine who reluctantly relieves the erratic Captain Queeg of command during a typhoon, leading to a court-martial.
filmography.plot: When a U.S. Naval captain shows signs of mental instability that endangers the ship, the executive officer relieves him of command and faces court-martial for mutiny.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture, Best Actor (Humphrey Bogart), Best Supporting Actor (Tom Tully)

filmography.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
filmography.role_description: The real-life pilot who participates in the Doolittle Raid on Tokyo, losing his leg in the process but maintaining his spirit.
filmography.plot: The true story of the first American retaliatory air strike against Japan during World War II, focusing on the crew of the 'Ruptured Duck'.

filmography.title: Battleground
filmography.role_description: A wisecracking, easygoing GI in the 101st Airborne Division who tries to keep morale high during the Siege of Bastogne.
filmography.plot: A squad of the 101st Airborne Division copes with the fog, snow, and Nazi siege of Bastogne during the Battle of the Bulge.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Screenplay, Best Cinematography; Nominated – Best Picture

filmography.title: In the Good Old Summertime
filmography.role_description: A music store salesman who bickers with his co-worker by day while unknowingly falling in love with her as his anonymous pen pal by night.
filmography.plot: In turn-of-the-century Chicago, two bickering music store employees unknowingly exchange anonymous romantic letters.

filmography.title: A Guy Named Joe
filmography.role_description: A young, eager pilot who is unknowingly guided by the spirit of a deceased ace pilot.
filmography.plot: A pilot killed in combat returns as a guardian angel to guide a younger pilot through the war and in romance.

filmography.title: The Human Comedy
filmography.role_description: The eldest son of the Macauley family, a soldier whose letters home provide comfort and guidance to his younger brother Homer.
filmography.plot: A teenage telegram messenger in a small California town comes of age during World War II while dealing with the effects of the war on his family and neighbors.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Story; Nominated – Best Picture, Best Actor (Mickey Rooney)

filmography.title: State of the Union
filmography.role_description: A cynical newspaper columnist and campaign manager who helps groom an industrialist for a presidential run.
filmography.plot: An aircraft tycoon is urged to run for President by a newspaper magnate, but his estranged wife forces him to confront his own integrity.

filmography.title: Command Decision
filmography.role_description: A cynical but dedicated technical sergeant who serves as a comic relief and voice of the enlisted men amidst the high-stakes decisions of the officers.
filmography.plot: American generals struggle with the heavy toll of daylight bombing raids over Germany and the political pressure to reduce casualties.

filmography.title: Brigadoon
filmography.role_description: A cynical, sarcastic New Yorker who stumbles upon a magical Scottish village with his friend and remains skeptical of its enchantment.
filmography.plot: Two Americans on a hunting trip in Scotland discover a village that appears for only one day every hundred years.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design, Best Sound

filmography.title: The Last Time I Saw Paris
filmography.role_description: A writer in post-WWII Paris who marries a wealthy woman but struggles with his own professional failures and the dissolute lifestyle of the era.
filmography.plot: An American writer recalls his tragic marriage to a beautiful woman in post-war Paris as he tries to regain custody of his daughter.

filmography.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street
filmography.role_description: A bitter, blind American playwright living in London who overhears a kidnapping plot and must use his other senses to solve the crime.
filmography.plot: A blind playwright overhears a conversation about a kidnapping and extortion plot, but struggles to get the police to believe him.

filmography.title: Miracle in the Rain
filmography.role_description: A cheerful soldier who meets a lonely woman in the rain, starting a romance that transcends even death.
filmography.plot: A lonely secretary falls in love with a soldier she meets in the rain, and their bond is tested when he is shipped overseas.

filmography.title: Scene of the Crime
filmography.role_description: A tough homicide detective who tries to solve the murder of a fellow officer, a departure from Johnson's typical 'nice guy' roles.
filmography.plot: A police detective investigates the murder of a colleague, suspecting it may have been an inside job or a setup.

filmography.title: Go for Broke!
filmography.role_description: A prejudiced officer assigned to command the 442nd Regimental Combat Team who learns to respect the courage of his Japanese-American soldiers.
filmography.plot: The true story of the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, a unit composed of Japanese-American volunteers who became the most decorated unit in US history.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Writing (Story and Screenplay)

filmography.title: Two Girls and a Sailor
filmography.role_description: A wealthy sailor who helps two sisters set up a canteen for servicemen and becomes the object of their affection.
filmography.plot: Two sisters start a canteen for servicemen and both fall in love with the same mysterious sailor who helps them.

filmography.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
filmography.role_description: A wounded war correspondent staying at the Waldorf-Astoria who falls for a stenographer, played by Lana Turner.
filmography.plot: During a weekend at the Waldorf-Astoria hotel, the lives of a movie star, a war correspondent, a stenographer, and a shady businessman intersect.

filmography.title: Easy to Wed
filmography.role_description: A reporter hired to compromise a wealthy woman in a libel suit scheme, only to fall in love with her.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor hires a handsome reporter to romance a socialite and frame her in a scandal to drop a libel suit.

filmography.title: The End of the Affair
filmography.role_description: A writer in wartime London who has a passionate, illicit affair with a married woman, leading to a crisis of faith and obsession.
filmography.plot: In war-torn London, a writer begins a passionate affair with the wife of a civil servant, only for her to abruptly end it for mysterious reasons.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actress (Deborah Kerr)

filmography.title: Divorce American Style
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, genial used-car dealer who becomes a potential suitor for a newly divorced woman in this satire on American marriage.
filmography.plot: A wealthy couple decides to divorce after 17 years of marriage, but they soon find that the single life is not as liberating as they expected.

filmography.title: Yours, Mine and Ours
filmography.role_description: A Navy warrant officer and friend who sets up the two main characters (played by Henry Fonda and Lucille Ball).
filmography.plot: A widower with ten children marries a widow with eight children, and they try to navigate the chaos of blending their massive families.

filmography.title: Three Guys Named Mike
filmography.role_description: A research scientist and one of three men named Mike who vies for the affection of an airline stewardess.
filmography.plot: An airline stewardess is pursued by three different men named Mike: a pilot, a professor, and an advertising executive.

filmography.title: Plymouth Adventure
filmography.role_description: The cooper on the Mayflower who falls in love with Priscilla Mullins during the perilous voyage to the New World.
filmography.plot: A dramatic retelling of the voyage of the Mayflower and the hardships faced by the Pilgrims during their first winter in the New World.

filmography.title: Men of the Fighting Lady
filmography.role_description: A Navy pilot who talks a blinded fellow pilot down to a safe landing on an aircraft carrier during the Korean War.
filmography.plot: The true story of Navy fighter pilots flying dangerous missions off an aircraft carrier during the Korean War.

filmography.title: The Bride Goes Wild
filmography.role_description: A womanizing author of children's books who hates kids but must pretend to be a wholesome family man to win over a straight-laced illustrator.
filmography.plot: A children's book author who dislikes children has to pretend to be a single father to impress a new illustrator.

filmography.title: The Purple Rose of Cairo
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as one of the actors in the film-within-a-film who becomes confused when the main character walks off the screen.
filmography.plot: In New Jersey during the Depression, a movie character walks off the screen and into the life of a lonely waitress.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Film; Oscar: Nominated – Best Original Screenplay
